intro: Camellia stenophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf camellia, is a flowering plant native to China. It is a member of the Theaceae family and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, camellia-like flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are narrow and leathery, with a dark green upper surface and a lighter underside. Camellia stenophylla blooms in winter or early spring, producing pink or red flowers that are highly ornamental.
